```{r echo=FALSE}

knitr::kable(head(pokemon, n = 10))
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
pokemon1 <- as.data.frame(pokemon)
```

```{r}
plot(pokemon1$Defensa, pokemon1$Velocidad, 
     main = "Defensa vs. Velocidad",
     xlab = "Defensa", ylab = "Velocidad")
```

```{r}
# Initialize total within sum of squares error: wss
wss <- 0

# Look over 1 to 15 possible clusters
for (i in 1:15) {
  # Fit the model: km.out
  km.out <- kmeans(pokemon, centers = i, nstart = 20, iter.max = 50)
  # Save the within cluster sum of squares
  wss[i] <- km.out$tot.withinss
}

# Produce a scree plot
plot(1:15, wss, type = "b", 
     xlab = "Número de clusters", 
     ylab = "Suma de errores intra grupo")

# Select number of clusters
k <- 4

# Build model with k clusters: km.out
km.out <- kmeans(pokemon, centers = k, nstart = 20, iter.max = 50)

# View the resulting model
km.out

# Plot of Defense vs. Speed by cluster membership
plot(pokemon[, c("Defensa", "Velocidad")],
     col = km.out$cluster,
     main = paste("k-means clustering de Pokemón con", k, "clusters"),
     xlab = "Defensa", ylab = "Velocidad")
```
